channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Lawmakers appear no closer to a deal as partial government shutdown continues
item.description: The shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is the latest example of bipartisan negotiations unraveling in the wake of a crisis that captures national attention.
item.content:encoded: The shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is the latest example of bipartisan negotiations unraveling in the wake of a crisis that captures national attention.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Former FEMA administrator shares how DHS shutdown could affect the disaster agency
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to former FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell about how the Department of Homeland Security shutdown will affect operations at the disaster relief agency.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to former FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell about how the Department of Homeland Security shutdown will affect operations at the disaster relief agency.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Savannah Guthrie issues new plea for her mom's return as police test DNA from glove
item.description: Authorities investigating the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie are testing DNA they hope will point them toward a suspect. The DNA comes from a glove that was found about two miles from Guthrie's house.
item.content:encoded: Authorities investigating the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie are testing DNA they hope will point them toward a suspect. The DNA comes from a glove that was found about two miles from Guthrie's house.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: Is that carb ultra-processed? Here's a test even a kid can do
item.description: The latest nutrition guidelines urge Americans to avoid highly processed food. But when it comes to carbs, many people don't know which ones are ultra-processed. Here's an easy way to find out.
item.content:encoded: The latest nutrition guidelines urge Americans to avoid highly processed food. But when it comes to carbs, many people don't know which ones are ultra-processed. Here's an easy way to find out.
item.dc:creator: Michaeleen Doucleff

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Lawmakers no closer to a deal as partial government shutdown continues, officials to meet for more talks as Ukraine war nears 4th anniversary, what is it about Olympics that gives athletes "the yips"?
item.content:encoded: Lawmakers no closer to a deal as partial government shutdown continues, officials to meet for more talks as Ukraine war nears 4th anniversary, what is it about Olympics that gives athletes "the yips"?
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Amber Ruffin's 'Bigfoot!' musical offers hope to anyone who's been othered
item.description: Amber Ruffin is a comedy veteran who's worked in improv on two continents, had her own show, authored two books and worked on Late Night with Seth Meyers for years. Now she's out with an off-Broadway musical.
item.content:encoded:
Amber Ruffin is a comedy veteran who's worked in improv on two continents, had her own show, authored two books and worked on Late Night with Seth Meyers for years. Now she's out with an off-Broadway musical.

(Image credit: Keren Carrión)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Texas Sen. John Cornyn faces stiff opposition in upcoming Republican primary
item.description: Sen. John Cornyn is seeking Texas Republicans' nomination for a fifth term, in a contest that has seen bitter and expensive attacks on all sides.
item.content:encoded: Sen. John Cornyn is seeking Texas Republicans' nomination for a fifth term, in a contest that has seen bitter and expensive attacks on all sides.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Schneider

item.title: Illinois child care providers on edge amid ongoing uncertainty around federal funding
item.description: Illinois is one of five Democrat-led states fighting the Trump administration's freeze on child care funding. Child care providers in the state say they will be forced to close if funding is halted.
item.content:encoded: Illinois is one of five Democrat-led states fighting the Trump administration's freeze on child care funding. Child care providers in the state say they will be forced to close if funding is halted.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Thomas Jefferson's weather recordings help create historical weather database
item.description: President Thomas Jefferson was big on recording the weather wherever he was. His notes on temperature, nature and rainfall are becoming a record on climate history.
item.content:encoded: President Thomas Jefferson was big on recording the weather wherever he was. His notes on temperature, nature and rainfall are becoming a record on climate history.
item.dc:creator: Nick Gilmore

item.title: Russia, Ukraine and US officials to meet this week for more talks to end the war
item.description: As the war in Ukraine nears its fourth anniversary, officials from Russia, Ukraine and the U.S. will meet in Geneva Tuesday for another round of talks aimed at ending the war.
item.content:encoded: As the war in Ukraine nears its fourth anniversary, officials from Russia, Ukraine and the U.S. will meet in Geneva Tuesday for another round of talks aimed at ending the war.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes
